title.narrative: World Bank ICT for dev Proj Preparation Facility

description.narrative: Insatsen har som mål att skapa förutsättningar för en systematisk uppskalning av ICT insatser inom icke-ICT områden så som fattigdomsminskning, jämställdhet, medborgardeltagande, minskad korroption och/eller jobbskapande åtgärder. Sidas stöd t studier ska leda till större insatser finasierade av Världsbanken. Jämställd användning av tekniken har ett starkt fokus.

This facility will strengthen the design and implementation of ICT4D components in strategic countries(for the WB and Sweden) and strategic sectors (health, agriculture etc). The Swedish support for studies is to ensure a stratigic interventions for WB support to governments' IT spending. The support both has a general and specific goal to target women.

participating-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The first objective of the trust fund was to accelerate the deployment of ICT applications for transformation of social and productive sectors. The focus was to tie the grants to potential downstream financing for greater impact (fourth objective). The ICT4D facility financed 11 upstream feasibility studies in order to leverage downstream financing by the World Bank and scale up interventions. The number of people who benefitted from productive sector projects was 900,163, of which 450,285 were women. The target of the social sector projects was to provide at least 50 000 people with better access to services, a figure that doubled at the end of the program to 101,710,200 people, of which 50,854,680 were women (which also surpassed the original target). The second objective of the Facility was Gender, i.e. Empowering women and girls through ICT, focusing on sectors where the use of technologies can improve women and girls’ livelihood and/or standing in society. The indicators for Objective 2 have been surpassed. The potential number of women and girls positively impacted by downstream Bank financing leveraged by the feasibility studies (improved livelihood) are 6 102 030 people. All grants financed by the facility were required to include a gender angle. This was a deliberate effort to reinforce interventions with a gender component and to achieve the first and second objective in each individual grant. In Zambia, the ICT Enhanced Services for Women Farmers in Irrigated Agriculture identified and started to implement ICT services to address agricultural information needs of women farmers. The third objective was knowledge, i.e. developing targeted knowledge products which can have immediate implementation impact in Bank lending in the two above areas. In December 2017, five knowledge products aiming at the engendering of ICT project components had been developed, which is five times the original target. In turn, these knowledge products informed 32 projects. The fourth objective was to impact a larger pool of Bank lending and other development partners. The volume of downstream financing leveraged and informed by the ICT4D Facility amounted to 868 million USD, in 9 countries. The original target was 150 million USD, of which 100 million would come from the World Bank (either IDA or IBRD). 32 feasibility studies managed to inform additional projects, which exceeded the target of 6-10 projects. One such example is the MOPA activity in Mozambique which informed a USD 63 million project aimed at improving the dissemination of quality socioeconomic statistics.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
